title: What were the surprising results of M. Donato's experiments with magnetism, and why did they raise ethical concerns?
first_phrase: This text describes a series of experiments conducted by M. Donato, an expert in the science of magnetism. The experiments were attended by a well-known doctor and produced remarkable results that generated a great deal of public interest. However, the doctor's conduct during the experiments was questionable, as he caused unnecessary harm to the subjects and even endangered their safety. In spite of this, the experiments themselves were impressive, proving the extensive knowledge of M. Donato in the field of magnetism. The text concludes with a warning against attributing supernatural powers to M. Donato, as the success of the experiments was due to his scientific expertise rather than any mystical abilities.

last_phrase: To sum up, while Mr. Donato's experiments may seem miraculous, they are in fact results of the concentration of well-known states that can be encountered individually to a greater or lesser degree. Therefore, they should be stripped of their supernatural character but still be considered extremely surprising and deserving of an impartial investigation. With the involvement of official representatives of science having taken place, we can expect a credible analysis of the case of magnetism to emerge soon.
